court.center: Court of Civil Appeals of Texas, Waco.

opinion.posture:
Appeal from District Court, Seventy-Fourth District, McLennan County; Giles P. Lester, Judge.
Proceeding in the matter of the estate of J. H. Norton, deceased, wherein M. B. Breeding offered for probate an instrument purporting to be the last will and testament of deceased. The instrument was contested by Pearl J. Naler and others. From an order of the county court admitting the instrument to probate, contestants appealed to the district court. From a judgment refusing to probate the instrument, proponent appeals.
Affirmed.
opinion.attorneys:
Jno. B. McNamara and Alfred Herbelin, both of Waco, for appellant.
Bryan Maxwell and Stansell Bryan, all of Waco, for appellees.
